MemberSignature.Value: public static IntPtr DangerousGetObjectDataByteOffset<T> (object obj, ref T data);
.method public static hidebysig native int DangerousGetObjectDataByteOffset<T>(object obj, !!T& data) cil managed
Public Function DangerousGetObjectDataByteOffset(Of T) (obj As Object, ByRef data As T) As IntPtr

Docs.typeparam: The type of field being referenced.
Docs.param: The input hosting the target field.
A reference to a target field of type within .
Docs.summary: Calculates the byte offset to a specific field within a given .
Docs.returns: The value representing the offset to the target field from the start of the object data for the parameter . The offset is in relation to the first usable byte after the method table.
Docs.remarks: The input parameters are not validated, and it's responsibility of the caller to ensure that the reference is actually pointing to a memory location within .

MemberSignature.Value: public static ref T DangerousGetObjectDataReferenceAt<T> (object obj, IntPtr offset);
.method public static hidebysig !!T DangerousGetObjectDataReferenceAt<T>(object obj, native int offset) cil managed
Public Function DangerousGetObjectDataReferenceAt(Of T) (obj As Object, offset As IntPtr) As T

Docs.typeparam: The type of reference to retrieve.
Docs.param: The input hosting the target field.
The input byte offset for the reference to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets a reference to data within a given at a specified offset.
Docs.returns: A reference at a specified offset within .
Docs.remarks: None of the input arguments is validated, and it is responsibility of the caller to ensure they are valid. In particular, using an invalid offset might cause the retrieved reference to be misaligned with the desired data, which would break the type system. Or, if the offset causes the retrieved reference to point to a memory location outside of the input instance, that might lead to runtime crashes.
